Tiber AI Community

Phi-3 mini 4k

Transformer 4K context Instruction TGI

Microsoft's Phi-3-mini-4k model running on Text Generation Inference (TGI). A compact yet powerful model optimized for reasoning, coding, and structured tasks.

‚ö†Ô∏è Before using this model, please review the license terms and usage rights on the Hugging Face model page.

üìä Model Specs

  • Model ID: microsoft/Phi-3-mini-4k-instruct
  • Context Window: 4096 tokens
  • Hardware: Intel Data Center GPU Max Series

üí™ Strengths

  • Code generation
  • Step-by-step reasoning
  • Math problems
  • Technical explanations

üéØ Use Cases

  • Writing and debugging code
  • Solving mathematical problems
  • Explaining technical concepts
  • Logical reasoning tasks

Reference Architecture: This represents a recommended setup using the provided repository. Always review the latest documentation for your specific use case.
flowchart LR Client([Client]) Traefik[Traefik Proxy] Auth[Auth Service] TGI[TGI Service] Client --> Traefik Traefik --> Auth Auth --> Traefik Traefik --> TGI TGI --> Traefik Traefik --> Client subgraph Internal["Internal Network"] Traefik Auth TGI end

Security & Performance Features

üîí Token-based authentication with automatic ban after failed attempts
üö¶ Rate limiting (global: 10 req/s, per-IP: 10 req/s)
üõ°Ô∏è Security headers and IP protection
üîÑ Health monitoring and automatic recovery
üöÄ Optimized for Intel GPUs

Quick Start Guide

Get up and running in minutes

1

Create Account

Create a standard account on Intel Tiber AI Cloud

Visit Intel Cloud Portal ‚Üí
2

Select Hardware

Select an Intel Data Center Max Series GPU VM

3

Clone Repository

Clone the TGI repository

git clone https://github.com/tiberaicommunity/xpu_tgi
4

Generate Token

Generate authentication token for secure access

python utils/generate_token.py
5

Start Model

Start the Phi-3 model

./start.sh phi-3-mini-4k
6

Test Model

Make a test request to verify deployment

curl -X POST http://localhost:8000/generate \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"inputs": "Hello, how are you?", "parameters": {"max_new_tokens": 50}}'
